did.abstract: The collection contains family correspondence as well as financial documents regarding the Davis family mercantile businesses in New York and Peru.

custodhist.p: Donated by the New Jersey Historical Society, 2001

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as the Davis Family Papers, The New-York Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Collection includes documents related to the "Davis Brothers" mercantile business in New York City (in 1888 located at 19 South William Street) and in Lima, Peru (Ferrari & Davis Merchants).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Collection includes correspondence, financial documents, and inventories that shed light on day-to-day operations of the "Davis Brothers" mercantile business, including supplies management, financial transactions, purchasing, etc. There are several letters of the members of the Davis family (the majority addressed to or written by Daniel H.B. Davis) which give a glimpse of their private life. Documents are in English and Spanish.

Folder 1 contains financial documents pertaining to business activities in Lima, Peru, dated 1862-1904 (bulk 1867). Folder 2 consists of business correspondence 1867-1889 in Spanish and English including copy letters on onion skin paper. Folder 3 contains domestic freight and shipping receipts dated 1862-1865, many from Camden & Amboy RR & Transportation Co. and the Coastwise Steamship Co. for freight from Philadelphia. Folder 4 consists of receipts from goods and services dated 1872-1904. Several of these receipts are for items from New York City department stores. Folder 5 contains personal notes, correspondence, and poems dated 1829-1915. Folder 6 contains documents pertaining to death and will of Dr. John Davis, who died in the spring of 1883, as well as documents relating to the death of other family members.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by subject and chronologically.
